                                                                                   03 September 2014
ETSAP-UCC Workshop
14 Feb 2014

Location: Cork
Organizing institution: University College Cork
Workshop hosts: UCC, ERI and ETSAP
   

The Energy Policy and Modelling Group will host an IEA-ETSAP funded international workshop on methodologies linking energy systems and economic models. The purpose of this workshop is to exchange experiences (methodologies and applications) on integrating energy systems models (with a particular focus on MARKAL and TIMES models) with economic models (with a particular focus on input-output and CGE models). The objective is to improve methodologies for providing feedback from energy systems model results to the economic drivers and for determining the economic impacts of different energy scenarios. The workshop takes place on 4-5 February 2014.
Interesting workshops and presentations will be hold during this two-day event. Among others on the agenda:

Policy Experiences and Future Requirements of Hybrid Energy-Economic Modelling
Neil Strachan, Matthew Winning. UCL Energy Institute.

Coupling a Computable General Equilibrium Model with a Bottom‐Up model: Lessons from GEMINI‐E3 experiments Marc Vielle. REME, Ecole Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne, Switzerland.

Economywide Implications of Detailed Energy Build Plans for South Africa
Bruno Merven. University of Cape Town

Integrating energy system models in a complementarity setting
Per Ivar Helgesen, Norwegian University of Science and Technology (NTNU)

The agenda can be downloaded here.
